**Purpose**: Short, actionable guidance for AI coding agents working on this VB.NET WinForms project.

- **Project root**: `SistemPakar/` (solution: `ProjectPBL.sln`).
- **Primary language & target**: VB.NET WinForms targeting `net8.0-windows` (see `SistemPakar.vbproj`).

**Quick start (build / run)**

- Restore & build with .NET CLI:

  `dotnet restore`  
  `dotnet build ./SistemPakar.vbproj -c Debug`

- Run locally (GUI; use Visual Studio for interactive debugging):

  `dotnet run --project ./SistemPakar.vbproj`

- Recommended: open `ProjectPBL.sln` in Visual Studio for design-time WinForms editing and breakpoint debugging.

**Database / external integration**

- Uses MySQL via NuGet package `MySql.Data` (v9.5.0) declared in `SistemPakar.vbproj`.
- Dev DB SQL files at repository root: `db_SistemPakar.sql` (and a duplicate `db_SistemPakar (1).sql`). Import into a local MySQL server before running.
- Connection string lives in `ModulKoneksi.vb`:

  `str = "server=localhost;user id=root;password=;database=db_Sistempakar"`

  Note: confirm the database name after import — this project expects `db_Sistempakar` (match or change this string).

**Key code patterns & conventions (project-specific)**

- Single global DB module: `ModulKoneksi.vb` exposes globals `conn, cmd, da, dr, str` and two helpers:
  - `BukaKoneksi()` — called from many forms (e.g., `LoginForm_Load`, `FormRegister_Load`) to open `conn`.
  - `BuatHash(text As String)` — returns SHA-256 hex string. Used for authentication.

- Authentication flow (exact examples):
  - `FormRegister.vb`: hashes user-supplied password via `BuatHash` then inserts into `tb_akun`.
  - `LoginForm.vb`: on login computes `BuatHash(txtPassword.Text)` and compares with DB via query:

    `"SELECT * FROM tb_akun WHERE username='" & txtUsername.Text & "' AND password='" & passwordInputHash & "'"`

  When editing authentication logic, update both `FormRegister.vb` and `LoginForm.vb`.

- SQL construction: this codebase uses inline string concatenation for queries (see above). If you refactor to parameterized queries, apply consistently across all forms.

- UI layout: Many duplicated WinForms across folders `Prodi - TI/`, `Prodi - TMD/`, `Prodi - TMJ/` and `General/` — look for repeated file patterns named `FormKonsul*`. Expect similar controls and logic duplicated per program.

**Startup / application flow**

- MainForm is set in `My Project\Application.Designer.vb`:

  `Protected Overrides Sub OnCreateMainForm()`
  `    Me.MainForm = Global.SistemPakar.LoginForm`

- Typical flow: `LoginForm` -> `Form1` (main menu) -> program-specific `FormKonsul*` forms.

**Files to inspect first for most tasks**
- `ModulKoneksi.vb` — DB connection + hashing
- `LoginForm.vb`, `FormRegister.vb` — authentication examples
- `My Project\Application.Designer.vb` — startup settings
- `SistemPakar.vbproj` — target framework, packages
- `db_SistemPakar.sql` — DB schema and seed data
- `Prodi - */` and `General/` folders — duplicated form implementations

**Testing & CI**

- No automated tests or CI config were detected in the repository. Keep changes small and verify by running the app or by loading forms in Visual Studio designer.

**When modifying code**

- Avoid editing the autogenerated `My Project\Application.Designer.vb` manually — change via Project Properties when needed.
- Keep `ModulKoneksi.vb` as the single source of truth for DB connection and hashing unless explicitly refactoring the whole access layer.
- If you switch to parameterized queries, update all call sites; many forms rely on string concatenation.

**Danger signals / gotchas**

- Inline SQL concatenation is widespread — be cautious of SQL injection risks and test DB queries thoroughly.
- Connection string uses `root` with empty password by default; confirm local MySQL credentials and change `ModulKoneksi.vb` accordingly.

**If you need to make a PR**

- Keep changes surgical: update a few forms or one module at a time, include tested DB changes, and document schema changes (if any) by updating or adding a SQL file next to `db_SistemPakar.sql`.

Feedback request: Review these instructions and tell me any additional patterns, directories, or workflows you'd like included or clarified.
